intro: Stenogyne hosakae, commonly known as the Hosaka's stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes approximately 13,000 species of flowering plants. This species is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or blue in color. It thrives in moist, shaded habitats, often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Stenogyne hosakae is considered a rare and endangered plant species.
